member.name: T:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies various styles for the border of an element in CSS.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.None
member.summary: No border; the computed border width is zero.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Hidden
member.summary: Same as `None`, except in border conflict resolution for table elements.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Dotted
member.summary: The border is a series of dots.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Dashed
member.summary: The border is a series of short lines.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Solid
member.summary: The border is a single, solid line.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Double
member.summary: The border is two solid lines. The sum of the two lines and the space between them equals the value of 'border-width'.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Groove
member.summary: The border looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Ridge
member.summary: The opposite of 'groove': the border looks as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Inset
member.summary: The border makes the box look as though it were embedded in the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Outset
member.summary: The opposite of 'inset': the border makes the box look as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Initial
member.summary: Sets this property to its default value.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Inherit
member.summary: Inherits this property from its parent element.
